message.content: To answer this question, we need to have a basic understanding of how animals regulate their body temperature. Some animals, such as mammals, have the ability to perspire or sweat in order to cool down in hot temperatures. Sweating helps to evaporate moisture from their skin, which helps to dissipate heat from their bodies. Option (A) is incorrect because running does not directly help animals regulate their body temperature in hot conditions. Option (B) is incorrect because hunting behavior is not directly related to adjusting to hot temperatures. Option (D) is incorrect because flying is not a behavior that helps animals specifically adjust to hot temperatures.

This question requires basic knowledge about how animals regulate their body temperature. Some animals, like humans and dogs, sweat or perspire to cool down in hot temperatures. Option (A) is incorrect because not all animals can run, and running does not necessarily help cool them down. Option (B) is unrelated to temperature regulation. Option (D) is incorrect because flying does not necessarily help animals cool down in hot temperatures.
